posts.message:
Micro:bit is an embedded system learning board, similar to Arduino in purpose. It supports Micro USB & Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE). 

It will be given to every 12 years old student in the UK in October, for free, in order to encourage them to program.
posts.caption: youtube.com
posts.description: BBC Micro:Bit Hands On with WIRED's Oli Franklin-Wallis http://wired.uk/7X1vOT he BBC has revealed the final design of its Micro:Bit computer in a launch eve...

posts.message: Share it among your friends for a better web!

If you know the search engine duckduckgo, they have a nice feature called !bangs
https://duckduckgo.com/bang
where you can search on websites directly e.g. search for "!so javascript" will take you to the javascript search page on stackoverflow:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/javascript

I made a chrome extension to enable this feature for google search, try it and let me know if there's any issue.
https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/google-bang/ioeeagpdellhhcpkgjejekfinfdaggon

posts.message: The first microship implant happened in 1998. This article has links to videos if similar implant operations!
posts.caption: en.wikipedia.org
posts.description: A human microchip implant is an identifying integrated circuit device or RFID transponder encased in silicate glass and implanted in the body of a human being. A subdermal implant typically contains a unique ID number that can be linked to information contained in an external database, such as perso…

posts.message: Self Starter demo & repo on GitHub
posts.caption: selfstarter.us
posts.description: Selfstarter is an open source starting point for building your own ad-hoc crowdfunding site. It was put together by Lockitron after they were turned down from Kickstarter.

posts.caption: linkedin.com
posts.description: Many technology companies are presented with a real challenge today. Very often it is not the funding or cash flow issues. It’s the developer talent. Or, rather, the shortage of it. As demand for software engineers grows, companies are finding it difficult to attract the skilled developers they need…
